H0.text: Which seabird that ranges widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific has the largest wingspan of any existing birds. Wandering Albatross's cousin, the Light-Mantled Albatross

H1.text: Which seabird that ranges widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific has the largest wingspan of any existing birds. Royal Albatross

H2.text: Which seabird that ranges widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific has the largest wingspan of any existing birds. Great Shearwater

H3.text: Which seabird that ranges widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific has the largest wingspan of any existing birds. אלבטרוס

A4.text: The snowy albatross has the longest wingspan of any living bird, reaching up to 3.7 m (12 ft).

A5.text: The snowy albatross has a mean wingspan of 3.1 m (10 ft 2 in) in Bird Island, South Georgia.

A6.text: Royal Albatross (ship), a luxury tall ship located at Sentosa, Singapore

A7.text: The great shearwater has a wingspan of 105–122 cm (3.5–4.0 ft).

A8.text: Albatross is one of a family of large winged seabirds.
